text: Budva () is a Montenegrin town on the Adriatic Sea, former bishopric and present Latin Catholic titular see. The coastal area around Budva, called the Budva riviera. It is the center of Montenegrin tourism, known for its well- preserved medieval walled city, sandy beaches and diverse nightlife. Budva is 2,500 years old, which makes it one of the oldest settlements on the Adriatic coast. It has about 14,000 inhabitants. == Other websites == * Official website of the city of Budva Category:Cities in Montenegro Category:Municipalities of Montenegro
title: Budva
